climbs.name: Sendero Luminoso
climbs.fa: David Kozak and Linda Pritchett, May 1987

content.description: This route is opposite Grand Canyon Donkey Trail. Goes across three dikes and ends with a hand crack. Two chickenheads mark the route.

climbs.name: Punish the Mosquito
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Dave Evans, Cyndie Bransford, Jim Angione, 11/90

content.description:
This route lies just right of center on the West Face of the East Wall of Grand Canyon; the left-most of 3 bolted routes on the right-hand section of this face. Begin left of a shallow crack/corner system.

Climb up and clip a bolt, then go down and begin climbing well to the right of the bolt. (Why this bolt was placed here is a mystery as the route does not go up past it). Up face to a horizontal (place medium gear here), then up and left to another bolt. (This bolt is also in a contrived spot). Move back right then up and then back left (10c) to easier ground. Up and left is a final bolt which is passed on the left (10a/b).

No real cracks are found at the top of the route, gear is found well to the right (as facing cliff). Walk off to the right. Bolts have been replaced in recent years (but should have been moved to protect the actual line of the route).
content.protection: Pro: to 3 inches (mostly for belay); 3 bolts.

climbs.name: Kokopelli
climbs.fa: Dave Evans, Cyndie Bransford, Todd Gordon & Jim Angione, November 1990

content.description:
Just left of the fabulous Bunking Broncos is this more difficult route of a similar nature.

Steep friction is the name of the game with the crux just before heading into an obvious horizontal crack (1.5" piece here). More of the same finishes the climb off.

Continuous and techncial moves on gritty rock make this a worthwhile but seldom done route. Two stars out of five.

climbs.name: Bunking Bronkos
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Cyndie Bransford & Tom Atherton, May 1990

content.description: This climb and others are located on a small west-facing wall that faces the wall with Grand Canyon Donkey Trail. Park at Split Rock, head southwest of the parking lot, enter a valley and look to your left.
content.protection: 3 bolts, pro to 3" for the anchor
